intro: Gyrostachys autumnalis, commonly known as the autumnal gyrostachys, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Gyrostachys autumnalis is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
